title: Build SmartBreak one-page tech-startup marketing website with diagrams, animations, and contact form

requirements.text: Create a single-page SmartBreak marketing website with 9 sections in this order: (1) Hero, (2) Problem, (3) Our Solution, (4) How It Works (6 steps), (5) Technology & Innovation, (6) Simulation & Proof, (7) Impact, (8) About/Research Background, (9) Contact.

quotes:
Website Structure:

1. Hero Section
...
9. Contact Section

acceptanceCriteria: Page renders all 9 sections in the specified order on a single scrollable route (no missing sections).
Each section has a clear heading matching the provided titles/headline text (or the exact provided Hero headline).
Layout remains readable and visually coherent across mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.

requirements.text: Implement the SmartBreak visual design system across the page: deep-tech IoT + power infrastructure look, dark-blue primary background/sections with electric-yellow accents, modern sans-serif typography, clean spacing, and professional engineering styling.

quotes: The website should look like a deep-tech IoT + power infrastructure startup. Use a clean layout, dark-blue + electric-yellow theme, smooth animations, modern sans-serif fonts, and professional engineering visuals.

acceptanceCriteria: All sections consistently use the dark-blue + electric-yellow palette (no random/competing accent colors).
Typography uses a modern sans-serif system with consistent heading/body scales.
Buttons, cards, and icons share a consistent style (radius, shadows/glow, borders) across sections.

requirements.text: Build the Hero section with the exact headline and subheadline provided, two CTA buttons (“Request Demo”, “Download Technical Brief”), and a subtle animated power grid / transmission line background visual.

quotes:
Headline:
“SmartBreak – Intelligent Detection & Automatic Isolation of Broken Power Lines”

Subheadline:
Preventing electrocution and fire hazards through real-time fault detection and automated isolation.

CTA Buttons:
• Request Demo
• Download Technical Brief

Background:
Subtle animated power grid / transmission line visual.

acceptanceCriteria: Hero displays the exact headline and subheadline text.
“Request Demo” scrolls smoothly to the Contact section.
“Download Technical Brief” downloads a local static placeholder PDF from the frontend (no backend needed).
Background includes a subtle animation effect (e.g., moving grid lines/particles) without harming readability or performance.

requirements.text: Implement smooth-scroll navigation behavior for in-page section jumps and add subtle on-scroll entrance animations for key section elements (headings, cards, diagrams) optimized for pitch/demo presentation.

quotes:
• Smooth scroll animation
• Optimized for pitch/demo presentation

acceptanceCriteria: In-page CTA jumps use smooth scrolling.
Each major section has at least one subtle entrance animation triggered on scroll/visibility.
Animations do not block interaction and remain performant on mid-range laptops and mobile devices.

requirements.text: Build the Problem section titled “The Hidden Danger in LV Distribution Networks” with the provided bullet points and an infographic-style visual showing: Broken conductor → Live wire → Public danger.

quotes:
2. Problem Section
Title: “The Hidden Danger in LV Distribution Networks”

Content points:
• Frequent snapping of LV overhead conductors
• Fallen wires remain energized
• High risk of electrocution and fire
• Existing relays cannot detect open conductor faults
• Rural areas lack advanced SCADA systems

Include an infographic-style visual showing:
Broken conductor → Live wire → Public danger

acceptanceCriteria: Problem section heading matches the provided title.
All listed bullet points are present and readable.
Infographic-style visual clearly shows the 3-step chain with arrows in the specified order.

requirements.text: Build the Our Solution section titled “The SmartBreak Solution” including the provided explanation bullets and a simple system architecture diagram showing: Consumer Unit → RF Communication → Transformer Control Unit → Isolation Actuator → SMS Alert.

quotes:
3. Our Solution Section
Title: “The SmartBreak Solution”

Explain:
SmartBreak is a low-cost, retrofit-friendly intelligent system that:

• Detects conductor break in real time  
• Uses multi-consumer validation logic  
• Automatically trips isolator  
• Sends GSM/LoRa remote alerts  

Include a simple system architecture diagram showing:
Consumer Unit → RF Communication → Transformer Control Unit → Isolation Actuator → SMS Alert

acceptanceCriteria: Solution section includes all provided bullet points.
Architecture diagram displays the 5 nodes in the specified order with arrows connecting them.
Diagram remains legible on mobile (stacks or scrolls horizontally gracefully).

requirements.text: Build the How It Works section as a 6-step horizontal flow using icons and clean layout, with these exact steps: (1) Conductor snaps, (2) Voltage loss detected at consumer end, (3) Battery-powered alert transmitted, (4) Transformer unit validates multiple alerts, (5) Isolation actuator triggered, (6) SMS notification sent to control room.

quotes:
4. How It Works Section (Step-by-Step)
Create 6 visual steps:

1. Conductor snaps
2. Voltage loss detected at consumer end
3. Battery-powered alert transmitted
4. Transformer unit validates multiple alerts
5. Isolation actuator triggered
6. SMS notification sent to control room

Use icons and clean horizontal flow design.

acceptanceCriteria: All 6 steps appear in the correct order with icons.
On desktop the layout reads as a left-to-right flow; on mobile it degrades to a vertical stepper without losing the step order.
Icons and connectors/arrows are consistent in style with the rest of the site.

requirements.text: Build the Technology & Innovation section using tech-style cards with icons for each listed highlight: multi-point validation logic, false alarm reduction algorithm, AI-ready fault classification, predictive monitoring (thermal + vibration sensors), GPS-based fault localization, solar-assisted backup system.

quotes:
5. Technology & Innovation Section

Highlight:
• Multi-point validation logic
• False alarm reduction algorithm
• AI-ready fault classification
• Predictive monitoring (thermal + vibration sensors)
• GPS-based fault localization
• Solar-assisted backup system

Use tech-style cards with icons.

acceptanceCriteria: Six cards are displayed, one per highlight, each with an icon and label.
Cards are responsive (grid layout adapting across breakpoints).
Card styling fits the dark-blue + electric-yellow theme and is consistent across the site.

requirements.text: Build the Simulation & Proof section showing “MATLAB Simulation Results” and the provided content bullets, including a waveform-style graphic placeholder.

quotes:
6. Simulation & Proof Section

Show:
“MATLAB Simulation Results”

Content:
• 230V, 50Hz AC system simulated
• Fault introduced at 0.5 seconds
• Voltage collapse detected
• Trip signal activated
• Zero false triggering

Include a waveform-style graphic placeholder.

acceptanceCriteria: Section heading includes “MATLAB Simulation Results”.
All simulation bullet points are present.
A waveform-style graphic placeholder is displayed and scales for mobile/desktop.

requirements.text: Build the Impact section titled “Impact on Society” with the provided bullets and strong visual storytelling using realistic power infrastructure imagery.

quotes:
7. Impact Section

Title: “Impact on Society”

• Saves human lives
• Prevents livestock deaths
• Reduces fire hazards
• Improves rural grid reliability
• Cost-effective large-scale deployment

Use strong visual storytelling.
...
• Use realistic power infrastructure imagery

acceptanceCriteria: Impact section title matches exactly.
All five impact bullets appear.
Section includes at least one strong visual (photo-style or illustration) consistent with power infrastructure theme.

requirements.text: Build the About/Research Background section including the provided description text about the project’s purpose and context.

quotes:
8. About / Research Background Section

Include:
Developed as an innovative electrical safety project focused on enhancing LV distribution protection without requiring full smart grid transformation.

acceptanceCriteria: About/Research section is present and includes the provided sentence verbatim or as a clearly equivalent paragraph without changing meaning.
Section styling matches the rest of the page and remains readable in dark theme.

requirements.text: Build the Contact section with a form containing fields: Name, Organization, Email, Message, and include two CTAs labeled “Partner With Us” and “Request Pilot Deployment”. Submitting either CTA should submit the form along with which CTA was chosen and show a success/error state.

quotes:
9. Contact Section

Fields:
Name
Organization
Email
Message

CTA:
“Partner With Us”
“Request Pilot Deployment”

acceptanceCriteria: Form includes Name, Organization, Email, Message inputs with basic validation (required fields, valid email).
There are two submit buttons labeled exactly as specified; submission records which CTA was used.
On successful submit, the UI shows a clear confirmation state and resets or disables appropriately; on failure, it shows a clear error message.

requirements.text: Implement backend persistence for contact submissions in the single Motoko actor, including a method to create a submission and a method to list submissions (for future internal review). Store timestamp, name, organization, email, message, and selected CTA.

quotes:
Contact Section

Fields:
Name
Organization
Email
Message

CTA:
“Partner With Us”
“Request Pilot Deployment”

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes an update call to create/store a contact submission containing: timestamp, name, organization, email, message, and CTA type.
Backend exposes a query call to list stored submissions.
Submissions persist across canister upgrades according to the template’s standard stable-state pattern (no data loss in normal upgrade flow).

requirements.text: Add static assets for placeholder diagrams/visuals and ensure the frontend renders them from the static public assets path (not via the backend). Include: hero background visual, problem infographic, solution architecture diagram, waveform graphic, and at least one power-infrastructure hero/impact visual.

quotes:
• Include placeholder diagrams
• Use realistic power infrastructure imagery
Background:
Subtle animated power grid / transmission line visual.

Include an infographic-style visual...

Include a simple system architecture diagram...

Include a waveform-style graphic placeholder.

acceptanceCriteria: All required visuals are included as static files under the frontend public assets directory and referenced by the UI.
No backend endpoints are used to serve images/diagrams.
Visuals render crisply on retina displays and scale appropriately across breakpoints.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in the main actor file).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or .tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx.
No third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity (not required for this marketing site).
nonGoals: Do not implement real-time features (no websockets/chat).
Do not integrate external email/SMS services; contact submissions should be stored in-canister only.
Do not build a multi-page CMS/admin UI for viewing submissions (backend listing endpoint only is sufficient).
Do not add complex product dashboards or user accounts; this is a marketing/pitch website only.
